info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 1:26PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Lewis and Clark and southwestern Cascade Counties through 200 PM MDT... At 126 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16 miles southwest of Wolf Creek, or 19 miles northwest of Helena, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wolf Creek, Marysville and Canyon Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
